css.missing-curly: You have a starting { but no ending } to go with it.
css.property-missing-colon:
Put a colon (:) between the property and the value.
Try: color: red

prettycss.block-expected:
Start a block using { after your selector.
Try: __error__ {
prettycss.extra-tokens-after-value: Looks like you're missing a semicolon on the line before this one.
prettycss.illegal-token-after-combinator: After a + or > in a selector, you need to specify the name of another element, class, or ID
prettycss.invalid-token: This line doesn't look like valid CSS.
prettycss.invalid-value: __error__ isn't a meaningful value for this property. Double-check what values you can use here.
prettycss.require-value: Put a value for __error__ after the colon.
prettycss.selector-expected: Use a comma to separate multiple tag names, classes, or IDs.
prettycss.unknown-property: __error__ isn't a property that CSS understands. Double-check the name of the property that you want to use.

html.align: Don't use the "align" attribute. Instead, use the CSS text-align property
html.background: Don't use the "background" attribute. Instead, use the CSS background property
html.bgcolor: Don't use the "bgcolor" attribute. Instead, use the CSS background-color property
html.frameborder: Don't use the "__attribute__" attribute. Instead, use the CSS border property
html.marginwidth: Don't use the "marginwidth" attribute. Instead, use the CSS margin-left and margin-right properties
html.marginheight: Don't use the "marginheight" attribute. Instead, use the CSS margin-top and margin-bottom properties
html.scrolling: Don't use the "scrolling" attribute. Instead, use the CSS overflow property
html.width: Don't use the "width" attribute. Instead, use the CSS width property
html.E002: Use lower case for attribute names
html.E005:
You need to put the value of the __attribute__ attribute in quotation marks
Try: __attribute__="myvalue"
html.E006:
Every attribute needs a value.
Try: myattribute="myvalue"
html.E007:
The first line of your HTML should always be:
<!DOCTYPE html>
html.E008:
The first line of your HTML should always be:
<!DOCTYPE html>
html.E012: You can't use the id "__id__" more than once in your HTML
html.E014: tags need a src attribute, with the URL of the image you want to display. Try:

E016.b: You shouldn't use the <b> tag. Use the <strong> tag instead
E016.big: You shouldn't use the <big> tag. Use the CSS font-size property instead
E016.center: You shouldn't use the <center> tag. Use the CSS property margin: auto instead
E016.font: You shouldn't use the <font> tag. Use the CSS font-face property instead.
E016.i: You shouldn't use the <i> tag. Use the <em> tag instead
E016.strike: You shouldn't use the <strike> tag. Use the CSS property text-decoration: line-through instead
E016.tt: You shouldn't use the <tt> tag. Use the <code> tag instead.

html.E017: Use lower case for tag names
html.E027: Put a <title> tag inside your <head> tag
html.E028: You have more than one <title> tag in your document; you should only have one
html.E030: You have an opening tag somewhere in the HTML that doesn't have a closing tag to match it.
html.E036:
Lines should be indented with four spaces.
Use the 'tab' key to increase indentation and the 'delete' key to decrease indentation.
